refnamediv.refpurpose: Extreme time-stretching algorithm by Nasca Octavian Paul.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The paulstretch opcode is a lightweight implementation of the PaulStretch time-stretching algorithm by Nasca Octavian Paul. It is ideal for timestretching a signal by very large amounts.

The Paulstretch algorithm works very similarly to other STFT-based timestretching methods, using overlap-add with a hanning window. Unique to paulstretch are the use of scrambled phase and very large window sizes (specified in seconds).

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: ift -- source signal function table. Deferred-allocation tables (see GEN01) are accepted, but the opcode expects a mono source.
